message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: String str = "123|apple|apple|apple|dog$";
        StringTokenizer strString = new StringTokenizer(str, "|");
        int i = 0;
        String str1 = "";
        String str2 = "";
        String str3 = "";

        while (strString.hasMoreTokens()) {
            if (i == 0)
                str1 = strString.nextToken();
            else if (i == 1)
                str2 = strString.nextToken();
            else if (i == 2) {
                str3 = strString.nextToken();
                break;
            }
            i = i + 1;
        }
        System.out.println("str1: " + str1);
        System.out.println("str2: " + str2);
        System.out.println("str3: " + str3);
        
<<<explanation>>>: In your code, you are using the wrong variable name "Loginstring" instead of "strString" when calling the nextToken() method. This is causing the loop to exit on the first iteration. By correcting the variable name to "strString", the code will correctly tokenize the string and assign the values to the respective variables.
